page.title: 16Local Government Elections
page.content: On Wednesday 15th May,1985, voters turned out in greater numbers than ever before.People could vote for {four different parties,the Democratic {Unionist Party, Ulster Unionist, Sinn {Fein}and the{Social Democratic Labour {Party.}This election used the P. R. system which intended the voters to number their choice of candidate by 1,2,3, etc. However some voters spoiled their votes by using an X or a tick which resulted in a lost vote. The District Councils of Dungannon, Cookstown, Armagh and Craigavon will all remain in{Unionist control.}In Dungannon Council areas the Ulster Unionists did very well and increased their votes from 7227 in 1981 to 7848 this year. In Cookstown the Ulster Unionists had a majority vote of two. At this election every voter had to produce{some form of identification.
